content: Calculate the likelihood of the occurrence of an event when rolling a single six-sided die. In addition, provide a breakdown of the possible outcomes and their corresponding probabilities in a tabular form.

When rolling a single six-sided die, each of the six faces has an equal probability of landing face up. Therefore, the likelihood of any specific event occurring, such as rolling a particular number, can be calculated as follows:

The probability of rolling any one specific number (e.g., a 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, or 6) is:

\[ \text{Probability} = \frac{1}{6} \]

This is because there is one favorable outcome out of six possible outcomes. 

Here’s a breakdown of the possible outcomes and their corresponding probabilities in tabular form:

| Outcome | Probability |
|---------|-------------|
| 1       | \( \frac{1}{6} \) or approximately 0.167 |
| 2       | \( \frac{1}{6} \) or approximately 0.167 |
| 3       | \( \frac{1}{6} \) or approximately 0.167 |
| 4       | \( \frac{1}{6} \) or approximately 0.167 |
| 5       | \( \frac{1}{6} \) or approximately 0.167 |
| 6       | \( \frac{1}{6} \) or approximately 0.167 |

Each outcome is equally likely, ensuring that the sum of probabilities for all possible outcomes equals 1.
